story.text: A __learning pod__ is a [[pod]], or small group of people, that is specialised for learning. Essentially it is the same thing as a [[research group]], but one that uses a particular methodology that we call [[agile learning]] as used in the [[academy methodology]].
[[Learning pods]] embodied. Always good to see them physical - [http://proto.institute/assets/aac31daf0d2a9d2a55410dfd7bf73fa7.jpg proto.institute]

story.text:
# See also

- [[Pod]] and [[Pods]]
- [[Livelihood Pods]]
- [[Learning Passport]]
- [[Nomadic Teaching]]
- [[Learning Roles]]
- [[Federated Wiki Roles]]
- [[Roles]]

item.title: Learning Roles
item.text: In conversation with [[Mike Caulfield]] we started to outline a series of [[Roles or Hats]] that might enable a more explicit contract with people working together on a [[Happening]]:

item.title: Pods
item.text: Here we discuss the creation of a new form of writing and research community that [[Mike Caulfield]] called a __Pod__. Other names for such groups are [[research group]], [[learning pod]]s, [[cells]], or [[happening]].

A __learning pod__ is a [[pod]], or small group of people, that is specialised for learning. Essentially it is the same thing as a [[research group]], but one that uses a particular methodology that we call [[agile learning]] as used in the [[academy methodology]].

# See also

- [[Belbin Team Roles]]
- [[Learning Passport]]
- [[Nomadic Teaching]]
- [[Federated Wiki Roles]]
